data.mission: Analyze and design a rubric-driven review and escalation workflow tailored to Art & Music content that identifies low-confidence, weak/missing citations, and high-impact queries (e.g., provenance, copyright, artist intent). Produce anchored example cases, propose disagreement-handling policies and active-learning prioritization rules, and outline an empirical measurement plan to quantify reviewer variance, time/cost, and end-to-end safety vs. throughput tradeoffs.

Conduct targeted investigations into outstanding questions in the Art and Music domain relevant to the project (e.g., provenance of works, historical context, artist influences, or contemporary reception). Gather and cite concise, reliable sources that clarify each question and highlight any gaps or contradictions that need follow-up.

Implement and run a minimal smoke-test command that writes /outputs/qa/logs/<timestamp>_smoke_test.log (python --version, basic imports) and commit/record the produced artifact as the new baseline for all future runs.

Patch the QA runner to detect container loss and automatically switch to a 'failsafe execution mode' that (1) runs only non-container checks, (2) captures full diagnostics, and (3) emits a standardized failure report to /outputs/qa/.
